review_text: We were visiting our aunt for her 80th birthday and decided to stay at an AirBnB instead of a hotel room. Laura was very accomodating. The home is older but it has been updated so the interior is modern. There is plenty of room and the four kids were able to have their own beds. The house is located on Indian Lake. We didn't have fishing poles but Laura allowed the boys to use their poles. The 11 and 14-year-old boys loved fishing off the deck and they were out fishing by 7 am. The 3 and 8-year-old girls loved playing in the private boat ramp and catching minnows. The swing on the back patio area was big enough for us all to get a family picture. The girls locked a couple of inside doors accidentally and the owner had someone unlock them right away. The boys didn't want to come on the trip because they thought they would be bored. However, after 18 fish were caught and released they can't wait to return. Awesome trip. We would love to rent this house again in the future.

review_text: Well maintained, peaceful property. Easy to check in. I was very impressed upon entering the place. I'm a clean freak, so I felt immediately relaxed when I saw that I had nothing to clean up (as in some unfortunate places). It was well equiped. Full size refrigerator, stove/oven, microwave, dishwasher, washer and dryer. Loved having the place to myself, my own bathroom. Plenty of room for luggage, huge closets, extra blankets. Airconditioning worked great. The ceiling fan in the bedroom was SILENT, which was awesome! Everything was as advertised! A bench on which to set things when entering which was great for unpacking and packing vehicle. My favorite thing was having my own garage space right next to the entrance. This meant that all the things in my car didn't have to sit out in the sun, as I travel continually and don't always want to unpack everything. And it is great for when arriving in the rain. Would stay again! Host is pleasant and responsive. Highly recommend. Thanks Nick!

We absolutely adore this farmhouse.
Although I selfishly would like for nobody else to know of the hidden treasure, there, so that it will be available any time we want to revisit, I want all of you to know just how precious it is. I hope couples and families find peace and rest and absolute pleasure when they visit as we certainly did.
I appreciate how someone updated only what was necessary while preserving what could be of the 106-yr old structure. The feeling and existence of old still exists with the perks of modern plumbing, appliances, etc. If you love farms and old farmhouses, this is your dream spot. While you cook in the kitchen, you look out to see an old white barn and the cattle who move and graze. During the fall, the cotton is healthy and in full bloom. The dawn just before sunrise is painted in beautiful colors - such a wonderful sky on which to affix your eyes while drinking coffee and praying in the mornings.
There is a screened porch off the kitchen / dining room and just 2 steps down is an covered porch with a fireplace. The evenings and mornings were cool in October when we visited. We built a fire for our kids and had s'mores in the evening and ate breakfast in the morning in front of the fire.
The pictures simply cannot capture the beauty of this place!
We hope to stay many times more in the future and make memories that will bring joy to recall!
